Hi, Iâ€™m Lennart! ðŸ‘‹ðŸ™‚

Iâ€™m a doctoral student in the Econometrics Group at Bielefeld University. I like data science and math, teaching both, and developing open source software. In my spare time, you can find me in front of a chess board or above the clouds.







Research Interests






Discrete choice models with a focus on preference heterogeneity and Bayesian estimation of latent class mixed multinomial probit models.
I explore methods for efficient initialization in numerical optimization and implemented the ino package to provide initialization tools.
Applied hierarchical HMMs to German stock data in my master thesis, improving trend detection across different time scales.










Recent Talks






Faster and more robust maximum likelihood estimation for random utility models, ICMC in Chile, 01.04.2024
Modeling unobserved choice behavior heterogeneity, 13th YRW at Bielefeld University, 16.02.2024
Facilitating probit likelihood optimization, Statistische Woche in Dortmund, 12.09.2023
Bayesian probit models for preference classification, IWSM, 18.07.2023
Initialization of numerical optimization in R, 12th YRW at Bielefeld University, 07.09.2023
Advances in the initialization of probit model estimation and the {ino} R package, 11th YRW at Bielefeld University, 18.11.2022
